biography.content: Dr. Bruna Zampieri earned her undergraduate degree in Biology from the São Paulo State University (Unesp), Institute of Biosciences, Humanities and Exact Sciences, São José do Rio Preto, São Paulo, Brazil, and her M.Sc. and Ph.D. from São José do Rio Preto School of Medicine, São José do Rio Preto, São Paulo, Brazil. During her Ph.D., she was granted a fellowship by the Coordination for the Improvement of Higher Education Personnel (CAPES-Brazil) to develop part of her Ph.D. project at the University of Colorado Denver and Case Western Reserve University. She trained as a Postdoctoral Scholar at the Division of Pediatric Neurology at Case Western Reserve University. At the beginning of 2019, she received her first grant as an independent investigator by São Paulo Research Foundation – FAPESP, São Paulo, Brazil to work on induced pluripotent stem cells from individuals with Down syndrome differentiation into neurons and glial cells to better understand the syndrome phenotype. Dr. Zampieri has spent the past 16 years studying Down syndrome and has authored or co-authored 17 peer-reviewed papers, 2 book chapters, and several abstracts. She is a member of the Trisomy 21 Research Society.
